messages.content:
You are a Google Drive data generator for a workplace benchmark. Your job is to generate realistic Drive file data based on scenario information.

The output must be valid JSON matching the Drive schema with:
- files: array of {id, name, mimeType (optional), content (optional text excerpt), modifiedTime (optional)}

Generate Drive files that reflect:
- Events from sub_scenarios_expanded (core scenario events, e.g., documents, reports)
- Events from noise_scenarios (unrelated workplace files)
- Respect noise_level: 0 = minimal noise, 1 = lots of unrelated files
- Respect depth: 0 = direct/obvious files, 1 = indirect/multi-step file references

You must output ONLY valid JSON matching the schema. Do not include markdown code fences.

raw_message.content:
{
  "files": [
    {
      "id": "mob-102-meeting-notes-template",
      "name": "MOB-102 - Planning Meeting Notes (Template)",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.document",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-11-17T09:55:00-05:00",
      "content": "MOB-102: Mobile Launch planning – performance & rollout

Context
- Jira: MOB-102 – Mobile App Launch - Planning meeting for performance and rollout risks
- Owner: Alex (PM)
- Participants: Alex (PM), Jordan (Eng), Sam (Sr Eng)
- Target duration: 45 minutes
- Target window: Next week during working hours (10:00–19:00 ET)

Proposed Agenda
1) Performance targets for v1 launch
   - Target startup time vs current (~1700ms)
   - API latency targets (p95 ~420ms and beyond)
2) Rollout plan and feature flags
   - Phased rollout strategy
   - Kill switches / feature flags
3) Risk areas
   - Authentication
   - Offline mode & caching
   - Monitoring / alerting
4) Next steps & owners

Notes
[To be filled in during/after the meeting]

Action Items
[To be tracked back in Jira under MOB-102 and related tickets (e.g., MOB-101)]"
    },
    {
      "id": "mob-102-meeting-time-scratchpad",
      "name": "MOB-102 - Meeting Time Exploration (Calendars Cross-check)",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.spreadsheet",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-11-17T11:10:00-05:00",
      "content": "MOB-102: Mobile Launch planning – perf & rollout
Candidate windows (based on calendars for week of 2025-11-24, 10:00–19:00 ET)

Participants: Alex (alex.smith@company.com), Jordan (jordan.johnson@company.com), Sam (sam.williams@company.com)

Source calendars reviewed:
- Alex: standup 10:00–10:20 Mon; 1:1 with Design 13:00–13:30 Mon; MOB Launch Check-in Tue 15:00–15:30; Ops Review Wed 11:00–12:00.
- Jordan: standup 10:00–10:20 Mon; Code Review: Offline Sync 14:00–15:00 Mon; Sprint Planning Tue 11:00–12:00; Focus Time Thu 16:00–18:00.
- Sam: standup 10:00–10:20 Mon; 1:1 with Taylor 11:00–11:30 Mon; Code Review: Offline Sync 14:00–15:00 Mon; Architecture Deep Dive Wed 15:30–16:30.

Initial candidate windows (45 min each):
- Mon 11/24 10:30–11:15 ET
  * Alex: free
  * Jordan: free
  * Sam: conflict risk – 1:1 at 11:00; could join late or shift 1:1

- Mon 11/24 15:15–16:00 ET
  * Immediately after Code Review: Offline Sync (14:00–15:00) for Jordan & Sam
  * Alex: free (no conflicts after 13:30)
  * Jordan: free after 15:00
  * Sam: free after 15:00
  -> Preferred by Jordan; acceptable to Sam

- Wed 11/26 13:30–14:15 ET
  * Alex: free between 12:00–15:15
  * Jordan: free around midday
  * Sam: free before Architecture Deep Dive (15:30–16:30)

Decision (based on email responses): lock in Mon 11/24 15:15–16:00 ET as final time."
    },
    {
      "id": "mob-102-calendar-invite-draft",
      "name": "MOB-102 - Calendar Invite Description Draft",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.document",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-11-17T13:00:00-05:00",
      "content": "Title
MOB-102: Mobile Launch planning – perf & rollout (45 min)

When
Monday, Nov 24
15:15–16:00 ET

Who
- Organizer: alex.smith@company.com
- Attendees: sam.williams@company.com, jordan.johnson@company.com

Location / Link
Zoom – https://zoom.company.com/j/123456789

Description (to paste into calendar)
Planning session for MOB-102: align on performance targets, rollout plan, and key risk areas for the Mobile App Launch.

Agenda
1) Perf goals & constraints (startup time, p95 API latency, error budgets)
2) Rollout milestones & feature flags (phased rollout, kill switches)
3) Risk review and mitigation ideas (authentication, offline mode, monitoring)

Related Jira
- MOB-102 – Mobile App Launch - Planning meeting for performance and rollout risks
- MOB-101 – Mobile App Launch - Core Feature (caching & perf work)

Notes
- Follow up with summary in Jira comment + update leadership in next weekly wins email."
    },
    {
      "id": "mob-weekly-wins-2025-11-10-14-draft",
      "name": "Mobile Launch - Weekly Wins Draft (Nov 10–14, 2025)",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.document",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-11-14T17:10:00-05:00",
      "content": "Mobile App Launch – Weekly Wins (Nov 10–14, 2025)
Owner: Alex Smith (PM)
Project: MOB (Mobile App Launch)

1) Performance
- Average app startup time improved from ~2000ms to ~1700ms (~15% faster week over week), driven primarily by the first round of caching work in MOB-101.
- p95 API latency dropped from ~500ms to ~420ms (~16% improvement), which should noticeably smooth out the onboarding flow and in-app navigation.
- Next: define concrete perf targets in MOB-102 planning meeting for v1 launch.

2) Growth
- Weekly active users increased from ~50k to ~55k (~10% WoW growth).
- New signups increased from ~10k to ~11k (~10% WoW growth), likely influenced by the referral banner experiment.
- Early qualitative feedback indicates improved perceived responsiveness.

3) Execution & Planning
- Planning milestone for the Mobile App Launch remains on track.
- Created Jira ticket MOB-102 to capture next week’s deeper planning discussion around performance targets, rollout plan, and risk areas (auth, offline, monitoring).
- Scheduling 45-minute planning session next week with Jordan and Sam during working hours (10:00–19:00 ET).

4) Highlights to share with leadership
- ~15% faster startup and ~16% lower p95 API latency vs last week.
- ~10% lift in weekly active users and new signups.
- Clear next step: MOB-102 planning session to lock in launch-ready perf and rollout plan."
    },
    {
      "id": "mob-weekly-wins-2025-11-10-14-final-email-text",
      "name": "Mobile Launch - Weekly Wins Leadership Email (Nov 10–14, 2025)",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.document",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-11-14T18:00:00-05:00",
      "content": "Subject: Mobile Launch - Weekly Wins (Nov 10–14)

Hi all,

Sharing a brief update on this week’s wins for the Mobile App Launch (Nov 10–14):

1) Performance
- We shipped the first round of caching work tied to MOB-101. As a result, average app startup time is now roughly 15% faster than last week, and p95 API latency is down by a similar margin.

2) Growth
- Weekly active users grew by about 10% week over week, and new signups are up by a similar ~10%. Early indications are that the referral banner experiment is contributing meaningfully here.

3) Execution
- The Planning milestone for Mobile remains on track, and we’ve created MOB-102 to capture next week’s deeper planning discussion around performance targets, rollout, and risk areas.

Please let me know if you’d like more detail on any of the above.

Best,
Alex

Notes
- Metrics pulled from analytics dashboard mob-weekly-2025-11-10 (period 2025-11-10 to 2025-11-14).
- This text was adapted from the "Mobile Launch - Weekly Wins Draft (Nov 10–14, 2025)" doc and posted as a concise summary for leadership."
    },
    {
      "id": "mob-analytics-weekly-2025-11-10-export",
      "name": "MOB Weekly Metrics Export - 2025-11-10 to 2025-11-14",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.spreadsheet",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-11-14T16:10:00-05:00",
      "content": "Mobile App Launch – Weekly Metrics (Export from dashboard mob-weekly-2025-11-10)
Period: 2025-11-10 to 2025-11-14

Metric,Current,Previous,Change (%)
Avg app startup time (ms),1700,2000,-15.0
p95 API latency (ms),420,500,-16.0
Weekly active users,55000,50000,10.0
New signups,11000,10000,10.0

Notes
- Performance improvements primarily due to caching changes in MOB-101 and image compression rollout.
- Growth partially attributed to referral banner experiment.

Usage
- Source of truth for numbers referenced in:
  * "Mobile Launch - Weekly Wins Draft (Nov 10–14, 2025)"
  * Leadership email: "Mobile Launch - Weekly Wins (Nov 10–14)"
  * Slack summary in #proj-mobile-launch on 2025-11-14."
    }
  ]
}
